intro: Persoonia rudis, commonly known as the rough-leaved geebung, is a shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and narrow, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically appearing in spring. Persoonia rudis is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ecological importance includes providing nectar for native pollinators and supporting various fauna.
